author: lsankar
content:
> It currently processes the block as a whole, as if it would be a regular eth1 block w/o ethash data, this is why preserving eth1 block's format is the easiest path. We may pass timestamp, block number, block hash to `insertBlock` invocation, but that would require additional work done on the engine side.
<@!425572898787426305> it feels marginally cleaner to derive time from the eth2 notion of slot (the eth1-engine knows the slot for a block it's processing, right?) than from something within the engine, but this seems like a minor point either way
